bluetooth_confirm.title: Discovered VR Basestation
bluetooth_confirm.description:
A {device_type} was discovered:

**{name}**
MAC: {mac}

Would you like to add this basestation to Home Assistant?

manual.title: Add VR Basestation
manual.description: Enter the MAC address and select the type of your basestation. You can find the MAC address using Bluetooth scanning tools or check your VR software.

pair_id.title: Vive Basestation Pair ID
pair_id.description: Enter the pair ID for your Vive basestation "{device_name}". This is required to control V1 basestations. The pair ID is typically a hexadecimal value like '1A2B3C4D'.

error.invalid_mac: Invalid MAC address format. Please use format like AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF
error.invalid_pair_id: Invalid pair ID format. Enter a valid hexadecimal value (e.g., 1A2B3C4D)

device_options.title: Configure {device_name}
device_options.description: Configure settings for your {device_type}. Adjust scan intervals, timeouts, and enable/disable specific sensors.

data_description.name: Custom name for this basestation device
data_description.info_scan_interval: How often to read device information like firmware and model (minimum 300 seconds)
data_description.power_state_scan_interval: How often to update device state - controls switches, buttons, and sensor (minimum 1 second, Valve basestations only)
data_description.connection_timeout: Maximum time to wait for Bluetooth connections (minimum 5 seconds)
data_description.enable_info_sensors: Show sensors for firmware, model, hardware, and manufacturer information

error.scan_interval_too_low: Scan interval is too low. Check the minimum values.
error.timeout_too_low: Connection timeout is too low. Minimum is 5 seconds.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred while saving options
